project.teaser: Within Horizon Europe, the Built4People partnership (B4P) aims, among other objectives, to connect to a set of national or regional Innovation Clusters in viWithin Horizon Europe, the Built4People partnership (B4P) aims, among other objectives, to connect to a set of national...
project.objective:
Within Horizon Europe, the Built4People partnership (B4P) aims, among other objectives, to connect to a set of national or regional Innovation Clusters in viWithin Horizon Europe, the Built4People partnership (B4P) aims, among other objectives, to connect to a set of national or regional Innovation Clusters in view of maximizing innovation impacts. The NEBULA projects will build upon this B4P and the New European Bauhaus initiative to activate and nurture a network of B4P Innovation Clusters, by implementing: - Improved visibility, adoption and uptake of innovative solutions that are in line with the New European Bauhaus thanks to increased awareness on benefits from innovation and better access to co-financing - Intensified, cross-sectorial and interdisciplinary peer-learning from front runners as well as cross-border cooperation and networking, - preparation for the long-lasting activities of the network of B4P Innovation Clusters and the integration of the next clusters.
This project will therefore accompany a first batch of existing and emerging clusters to increase their maturity along five dimensions: full value-chain coverage; cross-sectoral integration; combined local and national/EU networking; cross border connections; and access to testbeds and demo spaces such as pilot buildings and living labs.
NEBULA will support these clusters through ‘maturity push’ activities including peer learning on New European Bauhaus concepts, support to open innovation, business & finance help desk, match-making and promotional events.
A minimum of 5-7 clusters will be supported by NEBULA, some already identified being part of the consortium. At least 1 of them will reach full maturity on the 5 dimensions listed above, thus becoming a B4P Front runner, model for replication.
NEBULA consortium, that involves two contractual partners of the B4P partnership, will elaborate a Strategic Replication Plan to reach the contractual target of 10-15 B4P Innovation Clusters by 2028.
project.title: New European Bauhaus Unlocked through Built4People-endorsed Local Actions

article.title: Maximising innovation impacts through the Built4People partnership

result.title: B4P Innovation clusters requirements
result.description: This deliverable will include a set of requirements to establish a B4P Innovation Clusters network, including the needs, rules, boundaries and KPIs that a cluster must have to meet to be considered as a B4P Innovation cluster. It synthesises the findings of task T1.1.

result.title: B4P IC network foundation description
result.description: This deliverable will describe the setup of the B4P IC network including the resources produced, selection process and observations and lessons learned from soliciting, processing and launching first ICs in Tasks 1.3.

result.title: Synthesis of high potential innovations detected and promoted
result.description: This deliverable summarises the outputs of task 3.2, i.e. the identification of innovations with high market potential, in compliance with NEB core values.

result.title: Review of most promising co-financing models to foster open innovation
result.description: This report synthesises the findings of T4.1 and will identify the most promising public and private co-financing models that are best suited to each TRL.

result.title: User guidelines to the Metabuilding Open Innovation platform for B4P ecosystem
result.description: This deliverable will provide guidelines on how to use the Metabuilding Digital platform set up in Task 3.1, how to access to all the services of the Metabuilding Labs Open Innovation Testbed and how to use the dedicated virtual spaces for the B4P cluster managers.

result.title: Booklet of published inspiring stories
result.description: Positive and inspiring stories (formulated as ‘Examples’, ‘Ideas’, and ‘Challenges’) on identified innovations will be developed in Task 2.4 and will be published on the NEB platform.

result.title: Report on the activities of the finance help desk and good practices
result.description: This report concludes WP4 by summarising the activities carried out as part of the finance help desk, as well as recommendations on how to sustain this service beyond the project end (Task 4.4).

result.title: 1st report on public and private fundraising opportunities
result.description: This report provides an overview of the first fundraising opportunities identified in T4.2.

result.title: B4P innovation cluster Charter
result.description: This deliverable synthetises the outputs of task T1.2 and will include a description of the Charter, introducing to the value proposition of the B4P ICs network and commitments from the B4P ICs.

result.title: Presentation of the finance toolbox
result.description: This report describes the toolbox developed in T4.3 and how it can be accessed.

result.title: B4P ICs final network reporting
result.description: This deliverable will report about activities, conducted in task 1.4, from M12 to M30 with the ICs, awareness workshops - including update of B4PIC network description.

result.title: Report on undertaken peer-learning activities
result.description: This deliverable synthesises the output of task 2.3 and will describe the peer-learning activities undertaken (date, topics, participants, format etc).

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - NEBULA (New European Bauhaus Unlocked through Built4People-endorsed Local Actions)
result.teaser: The building sector is one of the key enablers for achieving low carbon economy goals for 2050. As a key implementation instrument, the EC has signed with the stakeholders’ representatives (ECTP & WGBC) a Memorandum of Understanding for a co-programmed European Partnership...

webItem.alternativeText: Map of the B4P Innovation clusters at the end of NEBULA
Benefits of the B4P Innovation Clusters Network

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Final Replication Plan
result.description: The final Replication Plan will constitute an update of the first version of the strategic replication plan, built upon the lessons learnt from all work packages and two dedicated workshops organised within task 5.5.

result.title: Report on the provision of open innovation support to clusters
result.description: Descriptive document on the functionalities and other support mechanisms for cluster management and interaction between clusters of the METABUILDING platform and on the direct coaching activities performed towards innovation cluster candidates.

result.title: First version of the Strategic Replication Plan
result.description: The Strategic Replication Plan, elaborated in Task 5.5, aims to provide a detailed roadmap and set of good practices to meet the target of 10-15 B4P Innovation clusters by 2028.

result.title: 2nd report on public and private fundraising opportunities
result.description: This report is an update of the deliverable D4.2 and will include new fundraising opportunities identified in T4.2, during the second year of the project.

result.title: Vade Mecum on blending the New European Bauhaus in with B4P Innovation Results
result.description: This deliverable will provide practical recommendations on how to better account for the NEB principles at all stages of the innovation life cycle. It synthesises the outputs of task T2.1.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
